title: The Upper Mississippi: A Wilderness Saga
description: The second volume of Rivers of America, UPPER MISSISSIPPI, tells the story of the coming of the Norse folk to the vast pineries and grasslands of the Middle West. Of Norse stock himself and a native of that region, Walter Havighurst is heir to must fascinating material, including actual happenings, traditions, and folktales, little known outside the Scandinavian-American communities. He tells of the country, of its discovery and settlement; of Cleng Peerson, leader of the first Scandinavian migration into the Middle West; of the slow, stubborn struggle in the basin of our greatest river to bring the land under cultivation.
author: Walter Havighurst
